foodTech.title: Intake of bean sprouts influences melatonin and antioxidant capacity biomarker levels in rats
foodTech.abstract: Kidney bean sprouts could be a good source of dietary melatonin and other bioactive compounds known to have health benefits.

foodTech.title: Bioavailability of Melatonin from Lentil Sprouts and Its Role in the Plasmatic Antioxidant Status in Rats
foodTech.abstract: We investigated the bioavailability of melatonin from lentil sprouts and its role in plasmatic antioxidant status. Their intake could increase melatonin plasmatic concentration and attenuate plasmatic oxidative stress.

foodTech.title: Teas and herbal infusions as sources of melatonin and other bioactive non-nutrient components
foodTech.abstract: The teas and herbal infusions could be consided as suitable drinks herein validated for their bioactive compounds that may act as antioxidants and non-protein inhibitors of digestive enzymes.

foodTech.title: Phenolic compounds from coffee by-products modulate adipogenesis-related inflammation, mitochondrial dysfunction, and insulin resistance in adipocytes, via insulin/PI3K/AKT signaling pathways
foodTech.abstract: Coffee silverskin and husk are beneficial in reducing adipogenesis and inflammation-related disorders.

foodTech.title: Extraction of phenolic compounds from cocoa shell: Modeling using response surface methodology and artificial neural networks
foodTech.abstract: Green extraction of phenolic compounds from the cocoa shell was modeled and optimized.

foodTech.title: Response surface methodology to optimise the heat-assisted aqueous extraction of phenolic compounds from coffee parchment and their comprehensive analysis
foodTech.abstract: Potential application of a useful, clean, environmentally friendly and cost-effective method to recover phenolic compounds from coffee parchment and to revalorize the by-product by converting it into high-added value new products to be used in the food.

foodTech.title: Black bean coats: New source of anthocyanins stabilized by β-cyclodextrin copigmentation in a sport beverage
foodTech.abstract: These black bean coat aqueous extracts and powders might represent natural alternatives to synthetic colorants, ecologically extracted, and with a high antioxidant potential.

foodTech.title: Coffee parchment as a new dietary fiber ingredient: Functional and physiological characterization
foodTech.abstract: Milling is a strategy for developing fiber-rich coffee parchment-based ingredients. Coffee parchment shows promising hypoglycemic and hypolipidemic capacities.

foodTech.title: Impact of Melatonin Enrichment during Germination of Legumes on Bioactive Compounds and Antioxidant Activity
foodTech.abstract: The melatonin-enriched foods exhibited potent free radical scavenger and antioxidant functions that may be used as a nutritional strategy to alleviate chronic and age-related diseases.

foodTech.title: Revalorization of Coffee Husk: Modeling and Optimizing the Green Sustainable Extraction of Phenolic Compounds
foodTech.abstract: The phenolic aqueous extracts from the coffee husk could be used as sustainable food ingredients and nutraceutical products.

foodTech.title: Relationship of the Phytochemicals from Coffee and Cocoa By-Products with their Potential to Modulate Biomarkers of Metabolic Syndrome In Vitro
foodTech.abstract: We identified the phytochemicals from coffee and cocoa by-products and offered new insights into their associations with biomarkers of inflammation, oxidative stress, adipogenesis, and insulin resistance in vitro.

foodTech.title: Cocoa Shell Aqueous Phenolic Extract Preserves Mitochondrial Function and Insulin Sensitivity by Attenuating Inflammation between Macrophages and Adipocytes In Vitro
foodTech.abstract: Cocoa shell phenolics promote a beige phenotype in adipocytes. Macrophages-adipocytes inflammatory interaction is reduced preventing mitochondrial dysfunction and insulin resistance.

foodTech.title: Inhibition of the Maillard Reaction by Phytochemicals Composing an Aqueous Coffee Silverskin Extract via a Mixed Mechanism of Action
foodTech.abstract: Isoflavones and melatonin may contribute to the antiglycative/antiglycoxidative properties associated with coffee silverskin.

foodTech.title: Phytochemicals from the Cocoa Shell Modulate Mitochondrial Function, Lipid and Glucose Metabolism in Hepatocytes via Activation of FGF21/ERK, AKT, and mTOR Pathways
foodTech.abstract: The cocoa shell phytochemicals are proved to modulate FGF21 signaling. Results demonstrate the in vitro preventive effect of the phytochemicals from the cocoa shell on non-alcoholic fatty liver disease.

gestationalHealth.title: Maternal plasma antioxidant status in the first trimester of pregnancy and development of obstetric complications
gestationalHealth.abstract: In early gestation, low antioxidants were associated with development of complications.

gestationalHealth.title: First trimester elevations of hematocrit, lipid peroxidation and nitrates in women with twin pregnancies who develop preeclampsia
gestationalHealth.abstract: We showed an association between red blood cells, hematocrit, malondialdehyde, and nitrates with preeclampsia in twin pregnancies.

gestationalHealth.title: Maternal Resources, Pregnancy Concerns, and Biological Factors Associated to Birth Weight and Psychological Health
gestationalHealth.abstract: The relevance of psychological health during pregnancy for maternal and neonatal outcome, and to consider it in preventive policies in OBS/GYN.

gestationalHealth.title: Effects of Arachidonic and Docosohexahenoic Acid Supplementation during Gestation in Rats. Implication of Placental Oxidative Stress
gestationalHealth.abstract: High arachidonic acid during gestation associates with intrauterine growth restriction, through placental oxidative stress, with females being more susceptible.

gestationalHealth.title: Maternal Psychological and Biological Factors Associated to Gestational Complications
gestationalHealth.abstract: High maternal melatonin and life satisfaction could be protective factors against the maternal complications during pregnancy. Low anxiety and cortisol and reduced work–life conflicts could prevent fetal complications.

gestationalHealth.title: Maternal Antioxidant Status in Early Pregnancy and Development of Fetal Complications in Twin Pregnancies: A Pilot Study
gestationalHealth.abstract: In twin gestations, maternal antioxidants and melatonin could be biomarkers to be included in algorithms to predict fetal growth restriction and preterm labor.

gestationalHealth.title: Early Association Factors for Depression Symptoms in Pregnancy: A Comparison between Spanish Women Spontaneously Gestation and with Assisted Reproduction Techniques
gestationalHealth.abstract: Women undergoing ART need interventions to reduce anxiety and stressful life events, and to improve resilience, self-esteem, and emotional partner support to prevent depressive symptomatology during early pregnancy.

gestationalHealth.title: Obstetric Outcomes in the Surviving Fetus after Intrauterine Fetal Death in Bichorionic Twin Gestations
gestationalHealth.abstract: Single intrauterine fetal death in twin gestations is a rare complication that should be monitored and attended by a clinical multidisciplinary team.

gestationalHealth.title: Women Aged over 40 with Twin Pregnancies Have a Higher Risk of Adverse Obstetrical Outcomes
gestationalHealth.abstract: Over 40 years old are an independent risk factor for complications in twin pregnancies.

gestationalHealth.title: Younger Age in Adolescent Pregnancies Is Associated with Higher Risk of Adverse Outcomes
gestationalHealth.abstract: Young adolescents are at risk of complications during pregnancy and labor.
